Title: 'Nafrat ki dukaan pe ...': PM Modi attacks Congress over 'brutality' in US
Summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized opposition leader Rahul Gandhi and parties like Congress during a rally in Jammu & Kashmir's Doda. He warned that restoring Article 370 would cause unrest and deprivation of reservations for Pahadi, SC, ST, and OBC communities. Modi emphasized BJP's initiatives to enhance infrastructure, education, and healthcare in the region.

Title: Blast in central Kolkata leaves 1 person injured, area cordoned off
Summary: A blast at Blochmann Street and S N Banerjee Road in Central Kolkata injured a 58-year-old rag picker named Bapi Das. Authorities cordoned off the area and summoned a Bomb Disposal Squad for inspection. Das is currently receiving treatment at NRS Hospital, with police and forensic teams investigating the incident's cause.

Title: Trump defends 'loony' Laura Loomer amid MAGA meltdown
Summary: Donald Trump is under fire from Republican allies over his association with far-right activist Laura Loomer. Despite her controversial views, Trump defends her as a supporter. This relationship has led to speculation about its impact on his presidential campaign and personal life, including the state of his marriage to Melania.

Title: 'This plane is going down': California man threatens to kill everyone on plane
Summary: Charles Angel Salva from California said he assaulted the crew because he did not want anyone to know that he was a pedophile. He said he molested his own child and lost the custody rights. He pulled the chain of the Frontier Airlines because he wanted the plane to crash. He felt that everyone on the flight wanted him to admit to his crime.

Title: Bengaluru woman sparks controversy with comments about Swiggy delivery executive
Summary: A Bengaluru woman's criticism of Swiggy for not employing Kannada-speaking delivery agents has sparked a social media debate. Her remarks have reignited the insider-outsider discussion in Karnataka, with locals advocating for job preferences for Kannadigas.

Title: 'Rohit didn't practice as hard as Sachin': Rhodes
Summary: Jonty Rhodes, former Mumbai Indians fielding coach, highlighted Rohit Sharma's different practice approach compared to Sachin Tendulkar. Despite lacking technical perfection, Rohit's relaxed demeanor and playful attitude have been crucial for his success as a batter and fostering a positive team atmosphere.

Title: Watch: Frustrated Alzarri threw at Hetmyer’s stumps. Next?
Summary: Alzarri Joseph displayed his frustration during a Caribbean Premier League match against the Guyana Amazon Warriors. After an intense exchange with Hetmyer, who hit a crucial six, the Warriors needed only nine more runs for victory. They secured the win by six wickets, chasing down Saint Lucia Kings' total of 101 in just 10 overs.

Title: Noida woman loses Rs 27 lakh in SIM card 'hacking': Big mistake she made
Summary: A Noida woman lost Rs 27 lakh to an eSIM fraud after receiving a WhatsApp call from someone pretending to be a telecom customer care executive. The scammer deactivated her SIM and accessed her bank accounts, siphoning off the money through multiple transactions. A case has been filed with the cybercrime police under relevant sections.

Title: BJP expels functionary after video of restaurant owner's apology to Sitharaman sparks outrage
Summary: BJP expelled a functionary after a video of a restaurant owner apologizing to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman went viral. The owner humorously criticized the GST system, prompting debates on its complexity. Opposition leaders condemned the government's handling and called for simplifying the GST structure.

Title: Fugitive Zakir Naik misleads Muslims on Waqf bill. Minister hits back
Summary: Union minister Kiren Rijiju denounced Islamic preacher Zakir Naik for disseminating false claims about the Waqf bill. Rijiju emphasized the need for unity against such divisive figures. The Waqf Amendment Bill, which aims to reform the management of Waqf properties, is currently being reviewed by a Joint Parliamentary Committee for broader consultation.

Title: 'Willing to have discussion': Doctors on Mamata Banerjee's 'last attempt' to resolve crisis
Summary: Junior doctors in West Bengal have approached chief minister Mamata Banerjee, expressing their willingness to engage in discussions to resolve their ongoing protest. A meeting is scheduled for 6pm at her residence. The doctors are demanding enhanced security measures at state-run hospitals following the rape and murder of a doctor at RG Kar Medical College.

Title: Govt extends deadline for updation of Aadhaar card details
Summary: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has extended the deadline for free online updates to Aadhaar card details until December 14, 2024. This extension enables all Aadhaar card holders to update crucial information such as address, name, mobile number and even photographs on the myAadhaar portal at no cost.

Title: Bill Maher versus Laura Loomer over 'arranged relationship' with Trump
Summary: Bill Maher said Laura Loomer looks like she's Donald Trump's type and wondered whether there is any arranged relationship between Donald Trump and Laura Loomer to affect thhe 2024 election. Laura Loomer accused Bill of defaming her and said she should sue Bill Maher for her character assassination campaign. She said she's a private citizen and an investigative journalist but is being targeted by the Democrats.

Title: Kenya's cult massacre: 'Good News' church tragedy that still haunts survivors
Summary: At least 436 bodies were found after authorities raided the Good News International Church in Kenya. The church's leader, Paul Mackenzie, faces charges of murdering children and manslaughter. Survivors recount brutality and radical practices. Despite warnings about his influence, police failed to intervene effectively.

Title: 'Water reached tomb of Shahjahan': After heavy rain, leakage at Taj Mahal
Summary: Agra's historical monuments, including the Taj Mahal, have been significantly damaged by continuous rain over 48 hours. The Archaeological Survey of India is investigating water seepage from the main dome and flooding in nearby gardens. Additional historical sites such as Agra Fort and Fatehpur Sikri have also sustained minor damage from the heavy rainfall.

Title: How MG Windsor’s EV battery subscription works: BaaS explained
Summary: MG Motors has unveiled the Windsor EV in India with an ex-showroom price of Rs 9.99 lakh, excluding battery costs. The company introduces a Battery as a Service (BaaS) program for leasing batteries. MG aims to launch new cars every six months, focusing on hybrids and electric vehicles to boost sales.

Title: Devil's Brutality: 5 most brutal Hell in a Cell Matches
Summary: WWE's Hell in a Cell matches are infamous for their brutality. This article reviews five of the most extreme moments: Shawn Michaels' elbow drop on Shane McMahon, Cactus Jack’s fall through the ring, The Undertaker’s excessive bleeding against Brock Lesnar, a severe chair shot to Shawn Michaels by The Undertaker, and Mankind’s painful experience with thumbtacks.

Title: Diljit Dosanjh cryptically reacts to sarcastic video on his expensive concert tickets
Summary: Diljit Dosanjh is set to begin his 'Dil-Luminati' India Tour, with tickets selling out swiftly despite high prices. Comedian Saloni Gaur's satirical video on ticket costs sparked a debate. Dosanjh expressed gratitude for the overwhelming response and hinted at possible good news for fans who missed out on tickets.

Title: 'If Iyer is thinking he is similar to Kohli...': Basit Ali
Summary: India's Shreyas Iyer faced criticism from former Pakistan cricketer Basit Ali after being dismissed for a seven-ball duck in the Duleep Trophy. Ali suggested that Iyer missed an opportunity to make a significant contribution and questioned his hunger for Test cricket. Iyer has been excluded from the Indian Test squad due to consistent poor performances.

Title: China's egg producing mountain: A geological mystery
Summary: In Guizhou Province, China, a cliff named Chan Da Ya has intrigued locals and tourists with its ability to produce large stone eggs every thirty years. Weighing up to 660 pounds, these stones are believed to bring good fortune. Scientists have yet to fully explain this phenomenon that has persisted for centuries.

Title: 'My father smeared Tiger's blood on my lips': Yograj
Summary: Yograj Singh, former cricketer and father of Yuvraj Singh, is renowned for his tough coaching methods. He played a pivotal role in Yuvraj's success and also trained Arjun Tendulkar. In a viral video, Yograj shares a childhood story illustrating his fearless approach to life and training. In addition to coaching Yuvraj, he also trained Sachin Tendulkar's son, Arjun Tendulkar.

Title: 'Gyanvapi not mosque, but Vishwanath himself': UP CM Yogi Adityanath
Summary: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath stated that Varanasi's Gyanvapi mosque should be recognized as Vishwanath (Lord Shiva) rather than a Muslim place of worship. This comes after a Varanasi court denied a petition for repairs at the site, which is contested by both Hindu and Muslim groups over its historical identity.

Title: FIR filed over fireworks outside Arvind Kejriwal's residence
Summary: Delhi Police have lodged an FIR over firecrackers being set off outside Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's residence after his release from jail. This follows a government ban on firecrackers to combat winter air pollution. The Supreme Court granted bail to Kejriwal in a corruption case related to the Delhi excise policy, leading to his release.

Title: Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh’s Rs 22 crore Alibaug home
Summary: Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh recently welcomed a baby girl and acquired a luxurious bungalow in Alibaug for Rs 22 crores. This estate spans 2.25 acres with an 18,000 sq ft built-up area. Previously owned by Rajesh Jaggi of The Everstone Group, the property is located near Kihim Beach in Satirje.

Title: 'Madhabi Buch investing in Chinese firms': Cong ups ante against Sebi chief
Summary: Congress has accused Sebi chief Madhabi Puri-Buch of making high-value investments in Chinese firms during geopolitical tensions and trading in listed securities with unpublished price-sensitive information. Buch and her husband issued a statement denying any conflict of interest involving Agora Advisory Pvt, Mahindra Group, Dr Reddy's, Pidilite, among others.

Title: ACT: Harman's brace gives India 2-1 win vs Pakistan
Summary: India triumphed over Pakistan with a 2-1 victory in their final league match of the Asian Champions Trophy hockey tournament beig held in Moqi, China. India captain Harmanpreet Singh scored both the goals for his team after an early lead by Pakistan. This win maintains India's unbeaten streak in the tournament and extends their dominance over Pakistan since 2016.

Title: Congress demands action against Noida DM over 'Pappu' post on Rahul Gandhi
Summary: Congress expressed outrage over an alleged inappropriate comment about Rahul Gandhi on the Gautam Budh Nagar district magistrate's official X handle. The party demands immediate action against the responsible officer. The magistrate claims his ID was misused and legal steps are being taken. Congress criticizes growing politicisation in India's bureaucracy, calling it a suppression effort.

Title: Case registered against SP MLA for 'torturing, assaulting' minor maid
Summary: Samajwadi Party MLA Zahid Beg and his wife Seema Beg have been charged with torturing a minor maid. This follows the suicide of another teenager at their home. The Labour Department intervened, rescuing a 17-year-old who had worked there for years, highlighting violations of child labor laws.

Title: Life is not 'khata-khat': Jaishankar's jibe at Rahul Gandhi in Geneva​​​
Summary: During his visit to Geneva, external affairs minister S Jaishankar addressed the Indian community, emphasizing that hard work is essential for India's progress. He highlighted the need for technology and manufacturing to become a major power. Jaishankar also discussed India's achievements in human resources and income tax collection, urging continued efforts for further development.

Title: Dalit boy stripped naked, forced to dance for stealing wire in Kota
Summary: A 12-year-old Dalit boy in Kota, Rajasthan was allegedly stripped naked and forced to dance after being accused of stealing wire from an event. The police have arrested six individuals connected to the incident. An FIR has been registered under several legal provisions including the POCSO Act and SC/ST Prevention of Atrocities Act.
